alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; St. Clair; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 03 at 3:30PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches except lighter amounts near state line. Winds gust as high as 35 to 45 mph. * WHERE...St. Clair, Livingston, Oakland, Macomb, Washtenaw, Wayne, Lenawee and Monroe Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 4 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Very heavy snow rates, on the order of 1 to 2+ inches per hour, are likely over a short three to six hour window. The peak rates occur late this afternoon into this evening followed by mainly light snow after midnight. Winds gusting to 40 mph may result in rapid reductions to visibility and isolated power outages will be possible from the cumulative impacts of accumulating wet snow and gusty winds. Amounts may be on the lower end of the range for parts of Wayne and Lenawee counties and especially Monroe county due to an intrusion of warmer air resulting in periods of rain.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; St. Clair; Washtenaw; Wayne
